intro: Helosis whymperi, commonly known as the Whymper's helosis, is a rare and lesser-known flowering plant. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers. The plant is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
